CatDescriptText: Cumi Peterson, clerical worker, 416 Halkett Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Yes, and because it was an area in which Negro businesses were located in the first place, so why shouldn't they have the businesses there now?"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cumi Peterson wearing light colored coat with collar and covered buttons, dark gloves, eyeglasses, and hat, carrying dark handbag with metal strap and clasp, standing in front of Bud Saunder's flower store window, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
